did.abstract: Topical files and writings of Michelle Krebs, a Detroit-based freelance automotive writer who served as editorial coordinator and contributing editor for various publications of the automotive industry as well as contributing journalist for newspapers and general-interest magazines.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: This collection was donated by Michelle Krebs (donor no. 10335) in 2010 and 2012.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by Michelle Krebs.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Michelle Krebs papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Michelle Krebs, a graduate of Syracuse University, is an authority on the automotive industry and, as a full-time freelance automotive journalist, writes regularly for numerous publications, such as the New York Times, the Detroit Free Press, Parade, Motor Trends, and Auto Week. She is an Adjunct Professor at Detroit's College for Creative Studies and served as president of the Automotive Press Association of Detroit. Ms. Krebs was the senior editor of Auto World, a monthly consumer magazine for car buyers, and the author of "Careers in the Auto Industry," which is included in a series that won the New York Public Library's award for best books for young people. She is the author of a syndicated automotive column, "Down the Road," which appears in numerous North American newspapers. At this writing (July 2010), Krebs was senior analyst and editor at large for Edmunds Auto Observer.

scopecontent.p: The Michelle Krebs collection includes her writings, in the form of newspaper and magazine clippings, as well as research materials collected as part of her professional work as analyst and journalist for the automotive industry. The papers are arranged in the following series: Writings, Topical Files, and Promotional Materials, Press Releases, and Publications, and Miscellaneous Audio Visual Materials. The 2012 accession contains additions to the Topical Files, Promotional Materials, Press Releases, and Publications series.

The Writings series includes magazine and newspaper articles written by Krebs and publications in which she served as editorial coordinator, as well as a copy of her book, "Cars," published in 1999 as part of the Careers without College series.

The Topical Files series includes documentation collected by Krebs on various topics related to the automotive industry, such as automobile insurance, vehicle safety features, and alternative fuel sources.

did.unittitle: Hybrid vehicles and alternative fuel 1998, undated
Promotional Materials, Press Releases, and Publications

scopecontent.p: Promotional Materials, Press Releases, and Publications includes brochures, photographs, slides, and press releases related to automobile shows, automobile companies, and suppliers of automotive components. In addition, there is an extensive collection of audiovisual materials promoting new car models and products during the period from 1981 to 2009.

did.unittitle: Audio/visual, primarily DVDs, CDs, CD-ROMs, with some VHS videotapes, circa 2003-2007

scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous Audio Visual Materials includes electronic copies of Ms. Krebs' documents and cassette tapes and CDs of her appearances on "The Auto Lab" an automotive broadcast series about the automotive industry, its history, and its culture.

did.unittitle: "The Auto Lab: a broadcast service of Automotive Technology," 1997-2008 (scattered)

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Michelle Krebs' collection of books about the automobile industry have been separately cataloged and placed in the library's printed collection.
